cards.targetLanguageWord: Me levanto a las seis todos los días.
cards.englishTranslation: I get up at six every day.
Can you repeat it more slowly, please?

cards.targetLanguageWord: Mi hermana es muy trabajadora, pero hoy está cansada
cards.englishTranslation: My sister is very hard-working, but today she is tired.
Whose notebook is this?

cards.targetLanguageWord: Me trae una botella de agua, por favor.
cards.englishTranslation: Could you bring me a bottle of water, please?
How much is it in total?

cards.targetLanguageWord: Vamos a salir a las ocho, ¿quieres venir?
cards.englishTranslation: We’re going to go out at eight, do you want to come?

cards.targetLanguageWord: ¿Dónde está la parada de autobús más cercana?
cards.englishTranslation: Where is the nearest bus stop?

cards.targetLanguageWord: Ayer no pude ir porque estaba trabajando.
cards.englishTranslation: Yesterday I couldn’t go because I was working.

cards.targetLanguageWord: Se me perdió la tarjeta de crédito.
cards.englishTranslation: I lost my credit card.
Good morning, how did you sleep?

cards.targetLanguageWord: Desayuno café y tostadas casi siempre.
cards.englishTranslation: I have coffee and toast for breakfast almost always.

cards.targetLanguageWord: Tengo que ducharme rápido porque llego tarde.
cards.englishTranslation: I have to shower quickly because I’m running late.

cards.targetLanguageWord: Salgo de la casa a las siete y media.
cards.englishTranslation: I leave the house at seven thirty.

cards.targetLanguageWord: Llego al trabajo a las ocho en punto.
cards.englishTranslation: I get to work at eight on the dot.
Today I’m working from home.
What time are we having lunch?

cards.targetLanguageWord: Almuerzo con mis compañeros los lunes.
cards.englishTranslation: I have lunch with my coworkers on Mondays.

cards.targetLanguageWord: Después de comer, siempre me da sueño.
cards.englishTranslation: After eating, I always get sleepy.

cards.targetLanguageWord: Termino de trabajar a las cinco.
cards.englishTranslation: I finish work at five.

cards.targetLanguageWord: Por la tarde saco al perro.
cards.englishTranslation: In the afternoon I take the dog out.

cards.targetLanguageWord: Por la noche veo una serie con mi familia.
cards.englishTranslation: At night I watch a show with my family.

cards.targetLanguageWord: Me acuesto tarde los fines de semana.
cards.englishTranslation: I go to bed late on weekends.
Can you speak more clearly, please?

cards.targetLanguageWord: No entiendo, ¿me lo puedes explicar otra vez?.
cards.englishTranslation: I don’t understand, can you explain it to me again?

cards.targetLanguageWord: Un momento, estoy ocupada ahora mismo.
cards.englishTranslation: One moment, I’m busy right now.
I’m going to the supermarket, do you need anything?
It’s very cold today, right?
It’s raining, take a jacket.
What time is it exactly?
It’s a quarter to three.
Today is Monday, isn’t it?
Tomorrow I don’t work, I rest.
Do you like getting up early?

cards.targetLanguageWord: No me gusta cocinar, pero lo hago.
cards.englishTranslation: I don’t like cooking, but I do it.

cards.targetLanguageWord: Siempre me olvido de cerrar la puerta.
cards.englishTranslation: I always forget to close the door.

cards.targetLanguageWord: Voy a preparar la cena ahora.
cards.englishTranslation: I’m going to make dinner now.
Can you wash the dishes, please?

cards.targetLanguageWord: Hoy no tengo ganas de salir.
cards.englishTranslation: Today I don’t feel like going out.
Sorry for being late.
It’s okay, no problem.
Where are the keys?
They’re on the table.
Open the window, it’s hot.
Close the door, please.
Can I use your phone?

cards.targetLanguageWord: Estoy aprendiendo español todos los días.
cards.englishTranslation: I’m learning Spanish every day.
I want to practice a bit more.

cards.targetLanguageWord: Solo hablo un poco de español.
cards.englishTranslation: I only speak a little Spanish.

cards.targetLanguageWord: ¿Cómo se dice esta palabra en español?.
cards.englishTranslation: How do you say this word in Spanish?
Can you write it, please?
Excuse me, where is the bathroom?
I live near here.
I’m ready, we can go.
I’m not ready yet.

cards.targetLanguageWord: Es la primera vez que vengo aquí.
cards.englishTranslation: It’s the first time I come here.
I like this city.
I don’t have much time.

cards.targetLanguageWord: Tengo dos hermanos y una hermana menor.
cards.englishTranslation: I have two brothers and a younger sister.

cards.targetLanguageWord: Mi mamá vive en otra ciudad.
cards.englishTranslation: My mom lives in another city.
My dad is very funny.
My grandparents are from Mexico.
Do you have children?
My son is eight years old.
My daughter is very creative.
This is my best friend.

cards.targetLanguageWord: Ella es alta y tiene el pelo negro.
cards.englishTranslation: She is tall and has black hair.

cards.targetLanguageWord: Él es bajo pero muy fuerte.
cards.englishTranslation: He is short but very strong.
We are a very close family.

cards.targetLanguageWord: Mi primo se va a casar el sábado.
cards.englishTranslation: My cousin is getting married on Saturday.
What is your family like?
My husband works a lot.
My wife is a teacher.
I’m single for now.

cards.targetLanguageWord: Estoy casada desde hace diez años.
cards.englishTranslation: I have been married for ten years.
We are busy today.

cards.targetLanguageWord: Estoy en casa de mis padres.
cards.englishTranslation: I’m at my parents’ house.

cards.targetLanguageWord: Mi casa es pequeña pero cómoda.
cards.englishTranslation: My house is small but comfortable.
Whose dog is this?
It’s my brother’s.
This phone is not mine.
Our neighbor is very kind.

cards.targetLanguageWord: Mi jefe es un poco estricto.
cards.englishTranslation: My boss is a little strict.
Today I’m very happy.

cards.targetLanguageWord: Ella está triste porque no vino su amiga.
cards.englishTranslation: She is sad because her friend didn’t come.

cards.targetLanguageWord: Somos de aquí, pero vivimos en otro país.
cards.englishTranslation: We’re from here, but we live in another country.

cards.targetLanguageWord: Mi hermano mayor vive en España.
cards.englishTranslation: My older brother lives in Spain.

cards.targetLanguageWord: Mi tía está enferma, voy a visitarla.
cards.englishTranslation: My aunt is sick, I’m going to visit her.
This boy is very smart.
My niece is very affectionate.

cards.targetLanguageWord: No estoy de buen humor hoy.
cards.englishTranslation: I’m not in a good mood today.

cards.targetLanguageWord: Estás muy guapa con ese vestido.
cards.englishTranslation: You look very pretty in that dress.
They are very different.

cards.targetLanguageWord: Él es serio, pero ella es muy habladora.
cards.englishTranslation: He is serious, but she is very talkative.
We have been friends since school.
I want to meet your family.
My last name is very common.
How do you spell your name?

cards.targetLanguageWord: Él siempre está de buen humor.
cards.englishTranslation: He is always in a good mood.
You are very quiet today.
My parents are on vacation.

cards.targetLanguageWord: Su casa está lejos de aquí.
cards.englishTranslation: Their house is far from here.

cards.targetLanguageWord: Esa chica es mi compañera de trabajo.
cards.englishTranslation: That girl is my coworker.

cards.targetLanguageWord: Este señor es nuestro vecino nuevo.
cards.englishTranslation: This man is our new neighbor.

cards.targetLanguageWord: No es mi novio, es solo un amigo.
cards.englishTranslation: He’s not my boyfriend, he’s just a friend.

cards.targetLanguageWord: Mi familia política es muy grande.
cards.englishTranslation: My in-laws are very big/family is very big.

cards.targetLanguageWord: Quisiera una mesa para dos, por favor.
cards.englishTranslation: I would like a table for two, please.
Do you have a menu in English?
What is today’s special?
I would like to try something typical.

cards.targetLanguageWord: Para mí, una sopa y una ensalada.
cards.englishTranslation: For me, a soup and a salad.
What do you recommend?
It’s very tasty, thank you.
The check, please.
Can I pay with card?
Do you have anything gluten-free?
I’m allergic to seafood.
I don’t eat meat.
Can you bring me more water?
How much do these apples cost?
Do you have something cheaper?
I’m just looking, thank you.
Where is the checkout?
I want to return this product.
It’s a bit big on me.
Do you have a smaller size?
I’ll take it.
Is the service included?
Can you give me a bag?
The soup is cold.

cards.targetLanguageWord: Esto no fue lo que pedí.
cards.englishTranslation: This is not what I ordered.
Sorry, how much was it?
Is there a discount if I buy two?

cards.targetLanguageWord: Busco un regalo para mi mamá.
cards.englishTranslation: I’m looking for a gift for my mom.
Are you open on Sundays?
What time do you close?
Can I try it on?
Do you have change for 50?
I want something to go.
For here or to go?
It’s very expensive.
It’s on sale today.
I love this restaurant.

cards.targetLanguageWord: Quiero reservar una mesa para esta noche.
cards.englishTranslation: I want to book a table for tonight.
Do you have desserts?
What is this?
Does it come with rice or with potatoes?
Can you give me the recipe?

cards.targetLanguageWord: Páguelo en la caja, por favor.
cards.englishTranslation: Pay for it at the counter, please.
The service was excellent.
The food arrived very late.
I don’t have cash.
Do you accept Apple Pay?
I’m missing a drink.

cards.targetLanguageWord: Necesito un taxi para el aeropuerto.
cards.englishTranslation: I need a taxi to the airport.
How long does it take to get downtown?

cards.targetLanguageWord: Voy a viajar mañana por la mañana.
cards.englishTranslation: I’m going to travel tomorrow morning.
What time does the train leave?
Where can I buy the tickets?

cards.targetLanguageWord: Voy a visitar a unos amigos.
cards.englishTranslation: I’m going to visit some friends.

cards.targetLanguageWord: Quiero ir a la playa este fin de semana.
cards.englishTranslation: I want to go to the beach this weekend.
Is it far from here?

cards.targetLanguageWord: Siga todo recto y luego gire a la derecha.
cards.englishTranslation: Go straight ahead and then turn right.
It’s two blocks away.
I don’t know where I am.
Can you show me on the map?
We’re going to be late.
I’ll wait for you at the entrance.
Do you want to go to the movies tonight?
I can’t today, but I can tomorrow.

cards.targetLanguageWord: Tengo una cita a las cuatro.
cards.englishTranslation: I have an appointment at four.
Is there a direct bus?
I missed the train.
My flight is delayed.

cards.targetLanguageWord: Reservé un hotel cerca del centro.
cards.englishTranslation: I booked a hotel near the center.
Where is the tourist office?
I want to see the historic center.
How much is the ticket?

cards.targetLanguageWord: Vamos a hacer una excursión mañana.
cards.englishTranslation: We’re going on a trip tomorrow.
Can you give me a ride in your car?

cards.targetLanguageWord: No tengo coche, voy en tren.
cards.englishTranslation: I don’t have a car, I go by train.
What time are we meeting?

cards.targetLanguageWord: Nos vemos a las siete en el parque.
cards.englishTranslation: See you at seven in the park.
I’m on my way.
I’ll arrive in ten minutes.
Where can I park?
This place is very touristy.

cards.targetLanguageWord: Quisiera una habitación con vista al mar.
cards.englishTranslation: I’d like a room with a sea view.
Is breakfast included?

cards.targetLanguageWord: Voy a estar aquí una semana.
cards.englishTranslation: I’m going to be here for a week.
Can I leave my suitcase here?
I’m looking for this address.
Does this bus go through downtown?
Get off at the next stop.
Where is the subway station?

cards.targetLanguageWord: Vamos a organizar un viaje en diciembre.
cards.englishTranslation: We’re going to organize a trip in December.

cards.targetLanguageWord: Quiero cambiar la fecha del vuelo.
cards.englishTranslation: I want to change the flight date.

cards.targetLanguageWord: No encuentro mi puerta de embarque.
cards.englishTranslation: I can’t find my boarding gate.
How much luggage can I take?

cards.targetLanguageWord: Necesito un mapa de la ciudad.
cards.englishTranslation: I need a map of the city.
Are there guided tours?
I’m lost, can you help me?

cards.targetLanguageWord: Me duele la cabeza desde ayer.
cards.englishTranslation: My head has been hurting since yesterday.

cards.targetLanguageWord: Necesito una cita con el médico.
cards.englishTranslation: I need an appointment with the doctor.

cards.targetLanguageWord: No me siento muy bien hoy.
cards.englishTranslation: I don’t feel very well today.

cards.targetLanguageWord: Perdí mis llaves y no puedo entrar.
cards.englishTranslation: I lost my keys and I can’t get in.

cards.targetLanguageWord: Se me olvidó pagar la factura.
cards.englishTranslation: I forgot to pay the bill.
The internet isn’t working.

cards.targetLanguageWord: Ayer tuve un problema con el banco.
cards.englishTranslation: Yesterday I had a problem with the bank.
I already called technical support.

cards.targetLanguageWord: El coche no arrancó esta mañana.
cards.englishTranslation: The car didn’t start this morning.
My battery died.
My wallet was stolen.
Where can I file a report?
It wasn’t my fault.

cards.targetLanguageWord: Llegué tarde porque había mucho tráfico.
cards.englishTranslation: I was late because there was a lot of traffic.

cards.targetLanguageWord: No pude ir porque llovía mucho.
cards.englishTranslation: I couldn’t go because it was raining a lot.

cards.targetLanguageWord: Me caí y me lastimé la pierna.
cards.englishTranslation: I fell and hurt my leg.
Is there a pharmacy nearby?
I need to buy medicine.
Can you repeat the address?

cards.targetLanguageWord: No escuché bien lo que dijo.
cards.englishTranslation: I didn’t hear well what you said.

cards.targetLanguageWord: La semana pasada viajé a otra ciudad.
cards.englishTranslation: Last week I traveled to another city.

cards.targetLanguageWord: Anoche cenamos en un restaurante nuevo.
cards.englishTranslation: Last night we had dinner at a new restaurant.

cards.targetLanguageWord: El año pasado estudié español en línea.
cards.englishTranslation: Last year I studied Spanish online.
I already finished the work.

cards.targetLanguageWord: Todavía no he recibido el correo.
cards.englishTranslation: I still haven’t received the email.
I called you a little while ago.

cards.targetLanguageWord: Se me olvidó contestar tu mensaje.
cards.englishTranslation: I forgot to reply to your message.
I was waiting for you.
I didn’t know you were coming.
I thought you had already left.
I’d like to clear up a misunderstanding.

cards.targetLanguageWord: Eso no fue lo que quise decir.
cards.englishTranslation: That’s not what I meant to say.

cards.targetLanguageWord: Creo que hubo un error en la factura.
cards.englishTranslation: I think there was a mistake in the bill.
Can I speak to the person in charge?
I didn’t receive the full order.
The air conditioner broke.
There was no hot water.
They already fixed it.
What happened yesterday?
Something unexpected happened.
They told me to call today.
They canceled my appointment.
I did it, but it didn’t work.
I already tried everything.
I couldn’t sleep well.
I’m waiting for a reply.
I don’t remember the password.
The power went out last night.

decks.name: Survival & Daily Routines
decks.description: Greetings, time, routine verbs (levantarse, desayunar, ir al trabajo, volver), likes/dislikes

decks.name: People, Family & Descriptions
decks.description: Family, physical descriptions, personality, possessions, ser vs. estar basics

decks.name: Food, Restaurants & Shopping
decks.description: Ordering, quantities, prices, polite requests, “lo/la/los/las”, quiero / me gustaría

decks.name: Going Places: Travel, Directions & Plans
decks.description: Transportation, future/near future (ir a + inf.), invitations, appointments, location questions

decks.name: Problems, Past Events & Real Life
decks.description: Common problems, at the doctor/bank/hotel, simple past (pretérito), excuses, clarifying
